neighborhood_overview: La Jolla California is an enchanting seaside community located within the city limits of San Diego. Dazzling ocean scenery awaits you in this exciting beachfront village. Everything that California is famous for can be found in La Jolla; white sand beaches, tide pools and sandy coves tucked between rocky cliffs, sunshine and year round comfortable temperatures lure thousands of visitors each year. Walk the exquisite beaches of La Jolla and watch sea lions and seals frolicking in the waves. The town of La Jolla is also home to a large salt water aquarium, and championship golf courses overlooking the Pacific Ocean are just minutes away. In downtown La Jolla you will still find many family owned businesses; art galleries, boutiques, antique shops, unique clothing and jewelry stores.
notes: Please note that a 3 night minimum is required for stays during most off season months (September - May) and a 7 night minimum with a Saturday to Saturday restriction is required during the high demand summer months of June, July, and August as well as all Holiday weeks. Also, for our guests convenience, the cleaning fee includes an accidental damage security deposit insurance policy which protects our guests for any accidental damage up to 2,000.  As a result, we do not need to collect a damage deposit for reservations.

space: This lavish 4BR/3.5BA recently remodeled house, resting on the side of Mt. Soledad in La Jolla, has breathtaking panoramic views of the Pacific and the mountains. The entrance leads you to the living room and formal dining area. The living room has vaulted ceilings, limestone floors, and a grand fireplace. Eight guests can sit comfortably on the three sofas. The spectacular sliding glass wall gives you access an outdoor living area and lets in loads of natural light. You won’t be able to take your eyes off the view of San Diego’s beaches. Step into the formal dining area where you’ll find seating for ten. This high-end Chef’s kitchen features new, pro-grade appliances: stovetop, ovens, coffee maker, extra-large fridge, dishwasher, and wine fridge. The breakfast area seats six with room for three more at the kitchen island. The kitchen also has direct access to the indoor/outdoor patio area. neighborhood_overview: This magnificent house is located on the south (sunny) side of Mt. Soledad and is conveniently located in La Jolla near beaches, Mission Bay, boutique shopping, fine dining, golf, hiking, and more! La Jolla Cove, San Diego’s best spot for kayaking, snorkeling, and diving, is only ten minutes away. When you’re ready for “seafood-centric” cuisine in an elegant setting, head to George’s at the Cove. The views are as good as the food, and it’s just a ten-minute drive. Hikers will love Torrey Pines State Natural Reserve while golfers have a choice of over 80 courses in San Diego County. This prime property is amazing in any season, so come and enjoy everything Southern California has to offer.

WIFI & CABLE Wifi and cable are provided as a convenience only.  We cannot provide any guarantees regarding Time Warner's service.  Having said that, we haven't had any issues since the month after we purchased the home in May 2013.  If you need it for your job or similar, you may be better off in a hotel with ba
neighborhood_overview: NEIGHBORHOOD OVERVIEW Our house is located on a quiet cul de sac in La Jolla.  It is very convenient to everything. Ocean and bay beaches, boardwalks, dozens of museums, sea world, the zoo, an amusement park, incredible restaurants, etc., are all within a 10 min. drive.
notes: Airbnb makes it difficult for hosts to post different prices for high and low season.  The prices that are posted are low season prices.  In general, prices are 4000-7000/week, plus 300 cleaning and 11.05% tax.
transit: GETTING AROUND You will need a car to get around.  There is tons of parking, both on the driveway (4 cars fit), and on the street.
access: GUEST ACCESS Guests have exclusive use of the entire property, but we (and our contractors) have access for maintenance, i.e., pool, landscape, repairs.  WIFI & CABLE Wifi and cable are provided as a convenience only.  We cannot provide any guarantees regarding Time Warner's service.  Having said that, we haven't had any issues since the month after we purchased the home in May 2013.  If you need it for your job or similar, you may be better off in a hotel with back-up wifi and cable and technicians on site.  We do not have any back-up and we do not have technicians onsite.
interaction: INTERACTION WITH GUESTS I live approx. 25 mins away. Depending on your arrival time, I will generally meet you at the house when you arrive.  If not, I will provide a lockbox code. I stop by a couple times to service the pool, check the mail, and similar.  If I am out of town, I have someone in the area to help you, but they will not stop by unless necessary.
house_rules: Please treat my house as you would your own.  Clean up after yourself.  Take out the trash. Don't smoke, anywhere (owner has extreme allergies.) If something breaks or stops working, let me know so that the next guests don't arrive to find something missing or broken.  Keep small children away from the pool table.  Make sure they change out of their bathing suits before sitting on furniture.  I do stop by every now and then to attend to the pool, lawn, etc.  Large events require special permission and an additional fee.  If you are having a large event without prior approval, I am likely to find out about it and your security deposit will be withheld.  I do have a rental agreement that I will require you to sign upon booking.  It details all of these things, and specifies a 500 fee if there is smoking on the premises.   Things that tick me off I am a fairly easy going person, but there are a few things that have ticked me off.  I had one group turn our Simply Amish solid cherry dining
host_about:
I love my house. We had originally wanted to get a ski condo, but we realized that we could not take proper care of the house and our guests if we didn't live nearby.  So instead we purchased this house in May 2013.  At the time, we didn't think we would use it much ourselves, but we do.  

Between renters, often while the maid is there, we drive down and hang out at the house.  We relax in the jacuzzi, where the only sound we can hear is the bubbles. We also enjoy swimming, foosball and shooting pool. From the house, it is an easy bike ride down to the beach and the bay (but a wicked ride back up the hill.)  I'm really into the outdoors, and I row on Mission Bay four days a week.  I also kayak (both ocean and bay), rollerblade, boogie board, swim masters and love hiking.  I love helping people find interesting outdoor activities.  

I have three children, 14, 17 and 19.  The 18 year old is in NY at Columbia.  The 17 year old is a year ahead at school, and will be graduating this year.  She works at the Pacific Athletic Club's daycare and summer camps.  She was there this summer and is working part-time during the school year.   So if you need a babysitter, she can handle anything.  If you need a babysitter who is fluent in Spanish, Russian or Mandarin, she has friends.  My son just swam the 2+ mile swim from La Jolla Cove to La Jolla Shores and back.  If you are looking for an ocean distance swim, we have a few we can recommend.

host_about:
As a  La Jolla native, I have seen many changes to our sweet village by the sea.  The constant however is the horizon; it is this endless view of magic that is just three blocks from my home and a perfect place to enjoy morning coffee and evening wine.

I am the grandmother of five lovely grandchildren, a retired school teacher having taught K through adult education, and a retired concierge from two magnificent local hotels.

Are there places you have traveled where you sense that you belong.....those places beyond the borders of your birth community?   It is one of my goals that your time in my home and in our village by the sea gives you that sense of belonging.

Passionate about  hospitality and meeting guests from all over the world, I look forward to  sharing the zen that my coastal home and garden paradise provides.

The room is about four blocks from the beach (a leisurely walk), and just down the hill from the aquarium (also walking distance).  The room includes a king sized bed, desk, dresser, upright piano, and bathroom w/ separate shower, bath tub, dual sinks & toilet.

Soledad, this beautiful house is located in one of the most exclusive residential neighborhoods in San Diego’s crown jewel - La Jolla, in a Gated community. Turn right, then immediately turn left, park on either side of the slightly down-sloping street, adjacent to the swimming pool. My house is the 5th one on the 1st street, to the right of the gate.
access: You will enjoy the private room with private bathroom. You’ll have access to high speed wireless internet, Cable TV, fridge, wine cooler, wall oven, microwave oven, toaster, and all amenities in the beautiful super clean house :)
interaction: •Please kindly consider the environment: recycle, conserve water and electricity & gas. •I have some food, wine, bathroom stuff @ home.  Enjoy what you like; Replace what you can :) •Replace what you break. •No drug, smoking or pets. Sorry, we do love pets. •Please do not run the water fountain for more than ½ hour each time - remember to Turn it OFF! The water evaporates and the pool becomes dry, so please be mindful of adding water to the pool. It is good Feng-Shui :) Enjoy the serenity
house_rules: Check in: 3PM Check out: 11AM •Please always Turn OFF all lights, appliances, lock the doors, put the house key back in the lockbox before leaving the house each day, and your final departure.  •Please remove shoes in the house. There are slippers in the coat-closet by the front door. •Please respect the neighbors: No loud music or noisy parties.
host_about:
I used to travel to Irvine to take classes. Angie is one of my favorite classmates! She is also the most kind and generous one to offer me to stay with her, and study together. I truly enjoyed her company and her hospitality!
Her house is like a beautiful mansion, spacious, bright and very clean! It will make your vacation so much more enjoyable than staying in a hotel room. She inspired me to become a hostess as well :)
I am a PhD student, also working full time to support myself. I enjoy learning from meeting people from different places & different cultures, so come on in! Me casa su casa :)

name: Poolside Studio suite, La Jolla!
summary: This large, private guest studio is part of a gated La Jolla home. It backs to lush landscaping on an acre of land with both valley and mountain views and looks onto a newly renovated pool (shared by homeowners).
space: This studio has a private entrance from the street as well as a private entrance to the studio itself. It is a well-equipped and beautifully decorated comfortable space with a private bath and a small kitchenette with: refrigerator, microwave, toaster oven and coffee maker. Sleeping accommodations include one queen bed and three single beds (one of the single beds is best for a child -- as is on the top bunk). Two of the single beds can be easily pushed together to form a king size bed for a second couple sharing the studio. This house is in one of the best La Jolla neighborhoods, conveniently located off of the freeway (not inside the sometimes busy La Jolla Village) and has plenty of free parking. What's more, is this house is only 2 miles from the beach and La Jolla Cove! Ideal for weekend travelers for romantic getaways! Also fantastic for visiting professors at UCSD or doctors/nurses/other healthcare visitors for Scripps La Jolla.
description: This large, private guest studio is part of a gated La Jolla home. It backs to lush landscaping on an acre of land with both valley and mountain views and looks onto a newly renovated pool (shared by homeowners).  This studio has a private entrance from the street as well as a private entrance to the studio itself. It is a well-equipped and beautifully decorated comfortable space with a private bath and a small kitchenette with: refrigerator, microwave, toaster oven and coffee maker. Sleeping accommodations include one queen bed and three single beds (one of the single beds is best for a child -- as is on the top bunk). Two of the single beds can be easily pushed together to form a king size bed for a second couple sharing the studio. This house is in one of the best La Jolla neighborhoods, conveniently located off of the freeway (not inside the sometimes busy La Jolla Village) and has plenty of free parking. What's more, is this house is only 2 miles from the beach and La Jolla Cove!
neighborhood_overview: The home is extremely convenient to several area highways to get to the best attractions without terrible traffic (beyond our control when it does occur).
transit: It is best to rent a car to enjoy your stay in San Diego to its fullest. We've had some very active guests who walk everywhere, but we think it's a hard commitment to make on a daily basis. There is a bus stop about one mile away. Bike rentals from local shops are also an option for some active guests.
access: The guest has full-use of the pool and pool deck. There is a "private" outdoor patio with a picnic table and chairs, an electric grill, and even a small private fire pit.
interaction: We are friendly owners who love to meet people from around the world. We are also cognizant that you may want to enjoy your time on your own. Therefore, we don't "actively seek out interaction" with our guests, but we are friendly and available during your stay. Some guests are quiet and keep to themselves, and we respect your privacy. Others are very outgoing and will join us by the fire outside at night and tell us stories about their travels.  Note: The main home is sometimes rented to other guests who are aware that the studio may also be rented and will follow guidelines to respect privacy of the studio guests, as well.
house_rules: Homeowners or other house guests reside upstairs but there is a bath, a private entrance along the side and rear of home, and plenty of street parking. Feel free to send us a message with any questions!  Check-in is strict at 4PM (unless otherwise arranged) and check out is a strict 10 AM in order to facilitate the next guests (which might be you).  HOT TUB BY PERMISSION ONLY AND NEVER AFTER 9:30 PM! (There is a hot tub on the property, but it is not advertised here for a specific reason. It is "permission based." Owner has a right to refuse use, charge additional funds for use, charge if it is broken or mistreated (excessively dirty/clogged), heated to excess or overheated constantly. Owner does not represent that hot tub is always available to guests because it can at times have chemical imbalances. Therefore, the hot tub is unadvertised and is "up for discussion" with the owner about rights and responsibilities during a rental. Please ask.)
host_about: Kimberly has owned rental property for more than 15 years, and has had several vacation rental properties over the past few years. She has managed properties ranging from one-bedroom condos to luxurious multi-million dollar estates. She has ultimately used this experience to manage her own properties and to educate other property owners about the vacation rental process, including advising owners about the little details that make a big difference in a guest's experience ;)

summary: Separate entrance. Ocean view room/bath with king size bed. 50"TV with HDMI cable for laptop, walk-in closet, fan, fridge, micro, toaster oven, hot plate with pot & pan, coffee machine. Goodies for breakfast. 240V outlet for electric car to plug in.
space: Our house is located in the Muirlands, a very private and quiet neighborhood. The room has a separate entrance.  There is a fridge, micro, toaster oven, hot plate with pot & pan and a coffee machine. In the fridge are some essentials such as juice, milk, butter, cream cheese, and  some bagels or rolls for your first day. A fruit plate, some snacks, coffee and tea are included. We have a freezer with ice for our guests outside. It can also be used for ice cream etc.   We can also provide you with a fan.  Our guests can use our off street parking. No smoking inside and no smoking in the garden. We are a smoke-free house.  Thanks for your consideration. No pets please. If you need anything just let us know. We will do our best to make you  feel comfortable at our place.

neighborhood_overview: The Muirlands are very safe. We are about 1 mile from the famous Windansea Beach (1 mi) and downtown La Jolla (1.5 mi) with lots of restaurants and shops. At the Cove and Children's pool ( 2 mi) you can watch sea life. La Jolla Shores  (3 mi) is good for surfing, kayaking, swimming, and walking the beach. From the top of Mount Soledad (3/4 mile) one can enjoy a breathtaking 360' view of our beautiful City. We also have an outdoor shower for rinsing off when coming from the beach. Thanks.
notes: We love kids. Crib and toys are available. We can supply an extra pull-out couch. The pool can be secured by a removable fence. We have a water slide for the kids. Our  grandchildren are always having a great time here.
transit: There is a bus stop about 10 minutes walk from our house (Nautilus/La Jolla Blvd). The airport, Balboa with the Zoo, Old Town, and downtown San Diego is about 20 minutes by car.
access: The guests can use the garden and the pool with lounges. The pool has a cover. In summertime it keeps the water comfortably warm. In winter the pool will not be heated.  There  is a charge of 10 per day for heating the Jacuzzi year round.   We have bikes, boogie boards and snorkel gear for our guests.
interaction: We are a retired couple and have lived in La Jolla for more then 30 years.  We can give you plenty of ideas what to do in San Diego. We will be home most of the time unless we are walking, swimming or kayaking.  We speak English, German and some French.
house_rules: We have to respect each others privacy. Quiet time between 10pm and 7am. No parties please. When leaving please turn the lights, the extra heater (in winter) or the fan (in summer) off. There is no smoking inside and outside of the house. We are a smoke-free house. Thank you.
host_about: My husband and I like to interact with people but also appreciate privacy.   We have lived in La Jolla for 38 years and have raised our children here. They have left the nest some time ago.  We are very interested in people and their stories. There is still so much to learn from others. We have travelled extensively ourselves and now enjoy settling down. My husband Reinhard is still very active with  kayaking and swimming in the ocean. He enjoys woodwork, building kayaks and recently tried some artwork.   My swimming days are over but I still love walking and some biking.  My hobbies are knitting and crocheting beanies, booties, scarves and knitting blankets with leftover yarn .  We are doing our best to make our guests feel comfortable. We love kids. We still have the toys our kids played with.

name: La Jolla Village - Walk Everywhere
summary: Perfect for 2-4 people. Three beds, three baths. Gourmet kitchen. Mediterranean garden in back yard. Quiet street two blocks from the village. Eight blocks to the ocean. Lots of towels!
space: This sophisticated home on a prime, tree-lined street is just two blocks from the heart of La Jolla Village. Walk to many shops and restaurants with an ocean view. One block to Starbucks, two blocks to supermarkets, four blocks to the Sunday Farmer’s Market, and eight blocks to the Pacific Ocean. Assorted beaches are within a 5-10 minute drive. Three bedrooms, 3 bathrooms + library. The Cape Cod style house is quiet and comfortable with wood and stone (travertine) flooring throughout and has both central air conditioning and heating. neighborhood_overview: La Jolla California is an enchanting seaside community located within the city limits of San Diego. Dazzling ocean scenery awaits you in this exciting beachfront village. Everything that California is famous for can be found in La Jolla; white sand beaches, tide pools and sandy coves tucked between rocky cliffs, sunshine and year round comfortable temperatures lure thousands of visitors each year. Walk the exquisite beaches of La Jolla and watch sea lions and seals frolicking in the waves. The town of La Jolla is also home to a large salt water aquarium, and championship golf courses overlooking the Pacific Ocean are just minutes away. In downtown La Jolla you will still find many family owned businesses; art galleries, boutiques, antique shops, unique clothing and jewelry stores.

neighborhood_overview: We are close to a beautiful beach, 3 blocks distance (though streetwise it is only 1.5 blocks).   You can walk to the end of the street and swim or simply watch the surfers at sunset.  We also have two surfboards and cheaper boogie boards if you'd care to use them, at your own risk.  We are about a mile walk from the center of the main shopping area of la jolla or there are lots of simple restaurants right around our home where you can walk to and eat within a block or two - breakfast, lunch and dinner.  The fancier places are towards downtown la jolla.   For entertainment, many people like to go to Sea World, the San Diego Zoo, a Padres/Chargers game or take tours around the Coronado, Downtown or the Hotel Del.  I know the areas well and would be happy to give you directions to about anything.
notes: In the back yard I have a small area divided off where we have a pot belly pig named Clementine and an even larger turtle named Caesar.  They quietly roam around.  Please do not touch them.  I also have a very quiet 11 year old black lab named Drager who stays in the back with me.  In the front there is a kind of windnsea shack (palm leaf covered sitting area) or cabana we sit underneath to enjoy the shade when for lunch or reading when the days are hot.  It is also a nice place to set a few candles and have dinner outside underneath on the patio.
transit: There is a bus stop less than block from house and it is easy to get everywhere from our place.  Take a look at (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN) maps.  Uber is generally a 5 min wait here.
access: You can rent the entire front house area.  There is a  smaller abode behind where I stay.  I can stay at a friend's and rent out both the front home and smaller cabana if people for want both; however I generally rent either the larger place in the front or the small little cabana in the back.
interaction: I will do my best to give you as much space as possible.  There is a small patio between your place (the larger home in the front) and the separate room/home were I stay behind yours.  I cld potentially rent out the place where I stay as well, but I generally rent one or the other.  As I noted, only the place up front has a bathroom and there is another door from the outside which allows me or a guest to use that bathroom when needed.  I try to limit my use during your stay and secondly you can deadbolt the bathroom door to your room which secures your area completely.
house_rules: I expect guests to be peaceful adults and treat the house with care just like we do. No smoking inside.  I am ok with it on the patios in the front or back, or back yard by the fire pit.
host_about: I'm a friendly, easy going person.  I meditate, play guitar and try to be a good dad.

neighborhood_overview: Stroll up the street just a few minutes to the famous Prospect Avenue in downtown La Jolla, often called "The Village."  Hosting five-star restaurants, world class shopping, the legendary La Valencia Hotel, and the Museum of Contemporary Art, the quaint village of La Jolla offers endless options for your enjoyment during your vacation. In addition to the amazing shopping and dining, the location is perfect for the outdoor activity enthusiast. You will find some of the world's most picturesque coastlines, fitness centers, and a tennis park just two blocks away. Nearby ocean activities also include sea kayaks, bodyboard and surfboard rentals, and diving. Or, just relax on the grassy bluff which is perfect for a  family beach picnic or enjoyment of an amazing La Jolla sunset.
notes: Within easy driving distances to all of the most popular San Diego attractions including Sea World, San Diego Zoo, Legoland, Petco Park for San Diego Padre baseball, Qualcomm Stadium for San Diego Charger football, the Gas Lamp Quarter, Tijuana, Mexico, bullfights, horseracing, fitness centers, gyms, Del Mar County Fair, Balboa Park Museums Complex, water-skiing, windsurfing, parasailing, jet skiing, and too many other activities to list.
transit: Driving, walking, biking, buses, taxis, Uber, Lyft.  We offer underground parking for your car.
access: Guests have access to underground parking along with the peace of mind that everything you can even think of or cherish is just a slight walk away in beautiful La Jolla Village.

neighborhood_overview: La Jolla is known as the jewel of San Diego for many reasons. The beaches are stunning, the weather is beautiful year round, there are so many things to do and yet you could be perfectly content to do nothing and just enjoy the scenery. Our condo is located at Windansea beach. There are some great restaurants right up the street, Su Casa (Mexican), the Mandarin House (great Chinese), and the Windansea Cafe for delicious breakfast, coffee and salad. It's a 10-15 minute walk to the Village where there is great shopping and more exquisite restaurants.
notes: There is no other place like this one! The views are stunning, the location is extraordinary! And we done everything we can to ensure you have a beautiful, impeccable, comfortable and luxurious place to stay while in La Jolla! You can also combine this unit with the unit next door to accommodate parties up to 12 people. We have a 4 night minimum. Holiday rates vary. Monthly rates available from September to May. San Diego has an 11.05% occupancy tax to be paid by guest. Since airbnb does not collect this tax, this will be charged via Special Offer upon acceptance of reservation.
transit: The condo is conveniently located walking distance from several beaches, restaurants and the Village. However, having a car is recommended as there are so many great things to do in San Diego. San Diego is a great destination for a family vacation! There are so many fun things to do like visit the San Diego Zoo, Sea World, Legoland, all a short driving distance away. You can also walk to the tides pools and visit the seals at the Cove, La Jolla Shores is a great swimming beach, you can cruise the boardwalk in Pacific Beach and visit the rollercoaster. Lots of great family entertainment!
access: Kitchen Our kitchen is fully stocked with a microwave, dishwasher, full size refrigerator, blender, toaster, coffee maker, brand new pots and pans, kitchen utensils and settings for 6 people. Dining We have a beautiful dining area that is off the living room and has spectacular view of the ocean. Living Room There is a queen size sofa bed in the living room. The bedding can be found in the linen closet. Internet There is wireless internet throughout the house. You will find the wifi code in the guest book. Phone We have a landline for your use for local calls. A/C There is an air conditioning unit in the living room for you to use as you please. Towels We have bath towels and beach towels for you to use during your stay. Washer Dryer There is a coin operated laundry facility in the building. Garage We have a one car garage that has an additional parking space behind it for your use. TVS Both the living room and the master bedroom have tvs. The living room has a brand new 50 inch flat s
interaction: I will meet you when you arrive, give you a tour and make sure you get settled and that all of your questions get answered. We live right up the street and are happy to help in anyway needed. I am a La Jolla local and love giving away my favorite restaurant, beaches, shopping and activities tips. There is also a guest book with more information in the condo.
house_rules: We want you to enjoy your vacation while respecting our home. No parties. Our family has lived in this building for years and we have a great relationship with our neighbors. We ask that you be respectful of their home. No parties are allowed at the condo. Our neighbors will notify us of inappropriate behavior and you will be asked to leave. If the police are involved you could be fined 1000 and we would be fined 1000 so you would lose your deposit as well. Again you would be asked to leave and in both instances you will not be refunded for the remainder of your stay. No pets. No exceptions. No smoking. Please do not smoke anywhere inside the building and if you smoke outside please respect our neighbors and the ocean and put your cigarette butts in the trash. No overnight guests. Only guests on the contract and in the original guest count are allowed to spend the night in the condo.

neighborhood_overview: Walking to the beach is an easy five minutes. This is not a typical beach community with crowded parking and loud parties with drunken revelers around. Yes it is in La Jolla, but not the 10million mansion areas. Think neighborhood built up casually over 100 years with each home different. Think people live here and work nearby like at UCSD or one of the many hospitals we have east of the Village of La Jolla. Think scientists and professors and doctors who live modestly. This is a totally walkable community if you like to walk:-) It is perhaps 20 minutes to the Village for shopping and dining. 25 minutes to La Jolla Cove for snorkeling, diving and kayaking.  We just got two bikes, helmets and locks for your enjoyment! Summer concerts at La Jolla Cove are free and nearby. The homes are fun to look at with each reflecting the owners' personalities. People are friendly and say 'hello' as you pass. It is amazingly beautiful to stroll around along the coastline for an hour or two as you wal
notes: The studio was built around the 1970s and designed with a western theme in mind with wrought iron fixtures in the bathroom and beautiful Spanish tiles in the shower. The wooden vanity is definitely rustic with watermarks from past years usage. Sadly the painter did not use a drop cloth and splattered paint on the tiles. Oh well, just adds to the authentic rustic look:) The wall division from the bedroom to the bathroom does not reach the ceiling so if privacy in the bathroom is ultra-important this is not your ideal arrangement.  We have a rollaway bed for a third person but it is a tight fit.  [just like in a hotel room - tight]. Please ask for details if you are considering this. If you practice yoga you will be pleased by the nice outside deck, delightful for a morning or evening yoga enjoyment. We can also recommend our favorite studios and teachers. We have two bikes/helmets for your use. And locks. There are lots of nearby beaches, food and shopping in Pacific Beach as well as La
transit: The bus stop is a three minute walk. You can drive to "The Village" in about five minutes to enjoy shopping and dining.  UTC Westfield Shopping Mall & theater is about a 20 minute drive east.  Tours are easily available from downtown San Diego and from Old Town - everything from craft beer tours [San Diego might be #1 in the country for craft beers] to a tour of San Diego highlights.
access: Friendly people around here. New friends are highly possible! Enjoy the patio. Eat breakfast outside watching the birds and butterflies and mostly sunny mornings.  High speed Wifi, basic TV, refrigerator, coffee maker, microwave, hairdryer. Additional, we have bikes, beach chairs and beach towels for you to use. Whoever is around is welcome to enjoy the garden. Bring out a drink to the patio. Have your breakfast in the patio. Meet others. Or not. This is a place for you to unwind. I have a note of welcome in your place that explains how everything works. If any questions come up, I am usually not far and I text.
interaction: We have hosted guests for decades and enjoy meeting people from all countries and all walks of life. We are usually available for help with information about quiet eateries, little-known places in the area. We enjoy our guests' enjoyment of beautiful La Jolla and all the fun to be found here.  Sometimes people want to come for a retreat: writers, business-owners or those somehow with very busy lives. We are sensitive and if our guests want solitude this is no problem at all.  Just let us know what you want.

I am easy going but professional. Busy during the day, early riser, enjoy conversations at times. My last teenager is gone from home. I enjoy reading and love to write.

Nearly every room can watch the surfers. The upper deck has an excellent view of the rocky tidepools below. A sandy beach is a short 7 minute walk away. Kids can watch a movie in the south living room, while adults enjoy a cocktail on the balcony, and grandparents gossip in the north living space. Nearly every bedroom has its own bathroom. neighborhood_overview: La Jolla California is an enchanting seaside community located within the city limits of San Diego. Dazzling ocean scenery awaits you in this exciting beachfront village. Everything that California is famous for can be found in La Jolla; white sand beaches, tide pools and sandy coves tucked between rocky cliffs, sunshine and year round comfortable temperatures lure thousands of visitors each year. Walk the exquisite beaches of La Jolla and watch sea lions and seals frolicking in the waves. The town of La Jolla is also home to a large salt water aquarium, and championship golf courses overlooking the Pacific Ocean are just minutes away. In downtown La Jolla you will still find many family owned businesses; art galleries, boutiques, antique shops, unique clothing and jewelry stores.
notes: Please note that a 3 night minimum is required for stays during most off season months (September - May) and a 7 night minimum with a Saturday to Saturday restriction is required during the high demand summer months of June, July, and August as well as all Holiday weeks. Also, for our guests convenience, the cleaning fee includes an accidental damage security deposit insurance policy which protects our guests for any accidental damage up to 2,000.  As a result, we do not need to collect a damage deposit for reservations.

neighborhood_overview: The seaside Village of La Jolla offers scenic beaches and delicious dining just just 20-minutes from the center of San Diego. Our vacation rental places you right in the middle of it all: walk to the beach and to the main strip of La Jolla. A playground, community pool, library and grocery store are within a few blocks. Breathtaking La Jolla Cove, a designated underwater park where you can snorkel, explore tide pools or watch the sea lions frolic in their natural habitat is just a mile away as is world-famous surfing spot Windansea. Popular restaurants such as El Pescador, Sammy's Woodfired Pizza and local favorite El Ranchero Verde are located within a block. You won’t need a car to to get around the village, but should you choose to venture out further, public transportation is around the corner and many of San Diego’s most popular destinations are within 15 miles by car.

neighborhood_overview: La Jolla California is an enchanting seaside community located within the city limits of San Diego. Dazzling ocean scenery awaits you in this exciting beachfront village. Everything that California is famous for can be found in La Jolla; white sand beaches, tide pools and sandy coves tucked between rocky cliffs, sunshine and year round comfortable temperatures lure thousands of visitors each year. Walk the exquisite beaches of La Jolla and watch sea lions and seals frolicking in the waves. The town of La Jolla is also home to a large salt water aquarium, and championship golf courses overlooking the Pacific Ocean are just minutes away. In downtown La Jolla you will still find many family owned businesses; art galleries, boutiques, antique shops, unique clothing and jewelry stores.

neighborhood_overview: This neighborhood is in the heart of La Jolla Village, a low key yet world class destination with its numerous beaches, restaurants, shops, museums, wildlife and festive atmosphere. The houses are all eclectic, some funky, others majestic. The neighborhood is safe and friendly. There is also a bicycling path in the  park one block away.
notes: Bring plenty of sunscreen as it is sunny 263 days out of the year. There is a hose by the front door to rinse your feet when coming back from the beach. You are in walking distance to two beaches- WindanSea (9 minutes- 5 -6 blocks) and Marine beach (14 minutes), as well as a 2 minute walk to Chinese-Mandarin House and Mexican-Su Casa restaurants. Not to mention a great breakfast and lunch place 3 minutes away. You are 2 minutes to the public bus stop, 20 minutes by car to Balboa Park and San Diego Zoo, and Airport. You can walk to La Jolla Village shops and to Prospect Street  for shopping and the Cove to see the Pelicans, Cormorants, Sea Lions lounging around. The movie theater is a 15-20 minute walk called The Lot, with its own restaurant and comfy lounge chair seats.
transit: You are a 2 minute walk to the public bus route. A car or uber is recommended if you want to go to Balboa Park or the Zoo.  We have provided 4 adult bicycles for riding around the neighborhood. The neighborhood is quite self contained with plenty to do just by walking to the beach, and the La Jolla, Village.
access: There is access to the entire house, except the owners closet in the garage. There is a parking pad out front. The garage has a studio space for the owners, Howard for painting, and Terese for woodworking and cars are not allowed to be parked there.
interaction: We have a property manager named Laleh  who lives nearby and will be available for contact as needed and to answer any questions you might have.
house_rules: This is a non smoking property, no pets. Children are welcome. The neighborhood is quiet and we respect the privacy of our neighbors. Therefore we respectfully request no loud music after 9:00 PM. We request that trash be placed in the regular or recycling containers outside of the house at the end of your stay. If you are staying on a Sunday and Monday please place the trash cans at the foot of the parking pad on Sunday night and the trash will be picked up on Monday, then place the cans back in their original resting space.

name: La Jolla Windnsea Beach Cottage
summary: Our cozy beach cottage is located in a friendly neighborhood just a few blocks from Windnsea Beach and restaurants. One bedroom, newly remodeled, complete with laundry access and beach amenities make this a true gem to get away and relax.
space: This bright and cozy cottage has a very open feeling with the kitchen, dining area, and living room being all contained in one main room. Additionally, the main living area has a sliding door with access to your own private back patio. The cottage is recently remodeled and has all new furniture, fixtures, and bedding.  The bedroom has a comfortable queen bed with a connected bathroom. Built-in cabinets and a large closet allow for ample storage. The bathroom has a new shower enclosure (no bathtub) with plenty of towels, shampoo, hairdryer, and other toiletry items. For additional sleeping space, the couch in the living room pulls out into another queen bed complete with bedding. The kitchen has all new major appliances including a stove/oven, refrigerator, microwave, and quartz counter-tops, along with a toaster and coffee pot. In addition, there are plenty of pots/pans, cooking utensils, glassware and silverware. We also supply paper towels and ziplocs/tupperware for your convenience.

neighborhood_overview: The Windnsea community is a very casual and friendly environment. You'll see folks walking around enjoying the scenery and also heading down to the beach or to one of our local restaurants. There is a walking path accessible from the top of our street with beautiful ocean views. The village of La Jolla is a comfortable 20 minute walk where you can visit famous La Jolla beaches such as La Jolla Cove and The Children's Pool (now a protected sea lion area).
notes: The cottage is suitable for 4 people max being a mix of adults and children.
transit: Even though much of La Jolla is withing walking distance, there is a bus stop conveniently located about 2 blocks away where you can pick up the 30 bus that takes you straight into Downtown San Diego. The airport is about a 25-30 minute drive from La Jolla.
access: The unit is detached from the main house and has street parking. There is a separate, gated entrance for access to the cottage in addition to a private back patio, complete with a gas bbq.
interaction: We are new to this vacation rental endeavour and will be available to you as needed; at the same time, we respect your privacy. We work days (sometimes from home), and are around the house most evenings and weekends. We would be happy to recommend restaurants, bars, sights to see and things to do in San Diego. Additionally, we have access to obtaining discounted tickets to many of San Diego's attractions, such as The Zoo, The Safari Park, Legoland, etc.
house_rules: No smoking inside the cottage.
host_about: We love to enjoy our city and explore all it has to offer. Spending time with friends and family, sipping on amazing craft beer, cooking up a storm, and working on our array of Pinball machines is how we spend our time!

neighborhood_overview: La Jolla California is an enchanting seaside community located within the city limits of San Diego. Dazzling ocean scenery awaits you in this exciting beachfront village. Everything that California is famous for can be found in La Jolla; white sand beaches, tide pools and sandy coves tucked between rocky cliffs, sunshine and year round comfortable temperatures lure thousands of visitors each year. Walk the exquisite beaches of La Jolla and watch sea lions and seals frolicking in the waves. The town of La Jolla is also home to a large salt water aquarium, and championship golf courses overlooking the Pacific Ocean are just minutes away. In downtown La Jolla you will still find many family owned businesses; art galleries, boutiques, antique shops, unique clothing and jewelry stores.
notes: Please note that a 3 night minimum is required for stays during most off season months (September - May) and a 7 night minimum with a Saturday to Saturday restriction is required during the high demand summer months of June, July, and August as well as all Holiday weeks. Also, for our guests convenience, the cleaning fee includes an accidental damage security deposit insurance policy which protects our guests for any accidental damage up to 2,000.  As a result, we do not need to collect a damage deposit for reservations.

neighborhood_overview: It is very quiet in the Muirlands.  A very safe place. We are about 1 mile from the famous Windansea Beach (1 mi) and downtown La Jolla (1.5 mi) with lots of restaurants. At the  Cove and Children"s Pool (2 mi)  you can watch sea life. La Jolla Shores (3 mi) is good for surfing, kayaking, swimming or walking along the beach. From the top of Mount Soledad (3/4 mi) one can enjoy a breathtaking 360' view of our beautiful City. We also have an outdoor shower for rinsing off the sand from the beach. Thanks.
notes: We love kids. Crib and toys are available. We can supply an extra pull out chair. The pool can be secured with a removable fence. We have a waterslide for the kids. Our grandchildren are always having a great time here.
transit: Public transportation is at La Jolla Blvd/Nautilus. The airport and the City of San Diego,  Old Town and Balboa Park  the with the Zoo are about 20 minutes by car.
access: The guests can use the garden and the pool with lounges. We have  a cover for the pool.  In summertime it keeps  the water comfortably warm. In winter the pool will not be heated.  There is a charge of 10 per day for heating the Jacuzzi, year round.  We have bikes and boogie boards which our guests can use. We also supply you with beach/pool towels. There is an outdoor shower to rinse off after the beach.
interaction: We are a retired couple and have lived in La Jolla for more then 30 years. We can give you plenty of ideas what to do in San Diego. We will be home most of the time unless we are walking, swimming or kayaking. We speak English, German and some French.
house_rules: We have to respect each other. Quiet time between 10pm and 7am. No parties please. When leaving please turn the lights, the extra heater (in winter) and the fan (in summer) off. No smoking inside and outside. We are a smoke-free house.
host_about: My husband and I like to interact with people but also appreciate privacy.   We have lived in La Jolla for 38 years and have raised our children here. They have left the nest some time ago.  We are very interested in people and their stories. There is still so much to learn from others. We have travelled extensively ourselves and now enjoy settling down. My husband Reinhard is still very active with  kayaking and swimming in the ocean. He enjoys woodwork, building kayaks and recently tried some artwork.   My swimming days are over but I still love walking and some biking.  My hobbies are knitting and crocheting beanies, booties, scarves and knitting blankets with leftover yarn .  We are doing our best to make our guests feel comfortable. We love kids. We still have the toys our kids played with.

summary: This cute La Jolla single family home built in the early 1900s makes for the perfect beach retreat. Simple and clean, it has everything you need to make your stay enjoyable, however doesn't have air conditioning (but cool at night and mid 70s-80s in summer since so close to the beach breeze). An easy 5 minute walk to world famous Windansea Beach makes it the ideal spot!
space: The perfect quaint home away from home for your vacation to La Jolla with children (or friends who act like children)! Two bedroom cottage with all the modern amenities. Walking distance (5-10 minute walk) to world famous Windansea beach for sunset or beach time.  A bike path into town nearby and dog park with swings for the kids right up the street. Cheerfully sunny home inside and private patio to relax outside and barbecue. Quiet and safe neighborhood.  A 5 minute walk to neighborhood coffee and food/drink places.  30 minute walk into main area of La Jolla Village or Pacific Beach where all the shops & restaurants are located.  2-3 adults max please since it is only one bathroom. name: Experience the California Lifestyle
summary: Come experience the California Lifestyle like the  surfers do. This is for Bedroom number 3 in our 4 bedroom house. You will be sharing a bathroom. We have been enjoying this so much we decided to make another bedroom available.
space: If you are looking to experience the laid-back, Southern California life style as a resident, this room in our home is for you! The house is bright and full of life with light colored hardwood floors and tall ceilings with floor to ceiling windows that overlook the pool. Bedroom #3 includes two twins that are put to gather to make a king size bed and a desk. You will also be sharing a bath. The house amenities include: full kitchen privileges (VitaMix, Espresso machine, microwave, oven and 5-burner stove), private pool, high speed wireless Internet, bikes, beach toys, Surfboards, Boogie Boards, Skateboards, wetsuits, fireplace and outdoor shower, etc. The Vibe  We keep the vibe here very relaxed. You will be sharing the home with me and my two children and up to three sets of guests (many of whom are international travelers). Or, you may be the only guest, depending on the season. Your room will be private but expect to share the common spaces with whomever is around. The neighborhood

You will be sharing the home with me and my two children and up
neighborhood_overview: We are located 500 feet from one of San Diego’s best surf beaches where you’ll find both experienced regulars and newbies catching their first waves. We are also steps away from the charming La Jolla Village home to great food, coffee and several excellent surf, kayak and snorkeling tour operators. For tennis enthusiasts, the historic La Jolla Beach & Tennis Club is down the road. We are also ideally located for sightseers: 15-20 from the San Diego International Airport; 10-15 mins. to Sea World; 10-15 mins. to Scripps, Birch Aquarium and UCSD; 20-25 mins. to the San Diego Zoo and downtown. No car? No problem. The municipal bus stop is just 200 feet away.
access: Everything!
interaction: Part of the package! If privacy or a quiet work environment is a requirement, a hotel might be a better fit. It can still be accomplished and we have had numerous people stay and get work done here.
host_about:
I love to travel and broaden my horizons. I have been a waiter and love to share my house and the La Jolla community with others. I have lived in La Jolla now since 1992. I have tons of information on what to do based on your taste and desires. I have surfed here and been a City of San Diego lifeguard (10 Years) So I know the ocean very well.

I have moved every two years of my life growing up and my wife was born and raised in Germany then moved to Italy for 7 years and now she feels she is an Italain.
My new favorite spot to go surfing is Nicaragua.
Five things that I cannot live without would be my family, iPhone, iPad, surfing and my wife wants me to include surfing again.

I love to listen to a lot of types of music.

My favorite motto comes from the Beatles song "The End"
"And in the end 
The love you take 
Is equal to the love you make"

When you stay with us I will do my best to make sure that you have a good time.

name: La Jolla, San Diego Beach Gem
summary: Come enjoy our former nanny studio in exquisite La Jolla. Hear the sea lions bark and walk down the hill to explore The Village, Cove and Beaches. Entire lower level of house with private entrance and deck can accommodate a family of four.
space: Set up just like a hotel studio suite with a queen bed and nightstand in one space, and a queen futon/sitting area in the other.  The two spaces are separated by a small step-down, but are not divided by walls so keep that in mind if you would like to try four adults.  There is a bathroom with a shower, and full closet with plenty of armoire storage.  Huge bonus is a full-size washer and dryer in the unit for your use on vacation!  Huge 55" LED TV with full cable, Blu Ray and wireless internet access.
description: Come enjoy our former nanny studio in exquisite La Jolla. Hear the sea lions bark and walk down the hill to explore The Village, Cove and Beaches. Entire lower level of house with private entrance and deck can accommodate a family of four. The two spaces are separated by a small step-down, but are not divided by walls so keep that in mind if you would like to try four adults. Huge 55" LED TV with full cable, Blu Ray and wireless internet access. The entire flat is yours with a keypad entry.  It is not connected at all to the main house so you have total privacy. We live upstairs so there is some noise when we are home.  Park in the driveway or there is plenty of neighborhood parking.  Enjoy ama
neighborhood_overview: We live in the beautiful and exclusive Country Club neighborhood in La Jolla with breathtaking ocean views and amazing sunsets.  Olivet is a quiet street, but just two blocks from The Village and all La Jolla has to offer.  Explore the world class restaurants and shopping, bark at the sea lions at La Jolla Cove, admire the harbor seals at The Children's Pool, enjoy multiple local beaches with surfing, snorkeling, swimming, spearfishing, paddle boarding -- whatever you want.  You can even walk further down the hill to the outstanding La Jolla Shores Beach for more ocean activities and rental shops for activities like kayak tours, scuba, snorkeling, etc.  There are also more incredible restaurants at The Shores.  And all of this is within walking distance.  There is so much more to explore in San Diego and our place will be your perfect launching pad!
notes: We typically get up at 7:00 a.m. and the kids are out of the house around 8:00 a.m.  I usually work from home but tend to travel throughout Southern California periodically.  So, I may be around a lot to help out during your stay or I may be out and about.  I am typically back home with the kids around 5:00 and our afternoons take us here, there and everywhere!
transit: Believe it or not, yes there is a bus! The MTS 30 bus stop is right down the street and you can take it one way through Pacific Beach all the way downtown, or the other way through the UTC area to downtown San Diego -- or connect anywhere in between, including the trolley station which has its own many destinations.  You also have the option of using taxis or Uber for other trips if you decide to come without a car.
access: The entire flat is yours with a keypad entry.  It is not connected at all to the main house so you have total privacy. We live upstairs so there is some noise when we are home.  Park in the driveway or there is plenty of neighborhood parking.  Enjoy amazing sunsets on the front garage rooftop deck and feel free to bbq in the backyard entertainment area.  Access to the house kitchen and refrigerator is available as well.  Small mini-fridge.  There is no kitchen in the unit.
interaction: I am a single professional dad with two amazing kiddos (Dannika is 9 and Jared is 7.)  We live in the main house above, so you will hear the pitter patter of little feet starting around 7 a.m. on weekdays as we get ready for school. Weekends are always something different with us.  Guests are welcome to join us for breakfast and the morning routine if they wish or they can stay down and enjoy the privacy of the room.  Since the accommodations are set up like a hotel suite (with coffeemaker/microwave), guests are welcome to come upstairs to use the main kitchen and refrigerator.  The same hospitality applies during the evenings.  Guests are welcome to join us upstairs or feel free to do your own thing around town.  La Jolla (and all of SD for that matter) is incredible and we look forward to meeting awesome (and respectful) new people!
house_rules: Sorry but no pets.  No smoking in the flat at all and only in the outside entertainment areas when the kids and I are not around.  Allergies (plus those things will kill ya!) Come and enjoy La Jolla, our family hospitality, and please be respectful.

description: This new listing is an enchanting cottage set on a quiet side street quarter block from the beautiful beach—Windansea. The cottage offers relaxed cozy comfort and sophistication and simplicity of classic modern design with a distinct European flavor. The cottage features top quality appointments from original artworks to luxurious details. The elegantly spacious, light filled, airy space opens through the wall of French doors to the sun-filled intimate tropical patio-paradise. Perfect for a romantic enjoyment of a couple or two-to-four persons. The home is steps from the shore of Windansea Beach, known for its spectacular scenery, sand and soft rock formations and turquoise-translucent surf breaks created by underwater reefs. The beach with its’ grass-roofed shack that dates back to the early 1940's and is designated as a National Landmark, enjoys a colorful history involving the quintessential California surfing and beach culture integrated into the exclusive high-end community of La
neighborhood_overview: The home is steps from the shore of Windansea Beach, known for its spectacular scenery, sand and soft rock formations and turquoise-translucent surf breaks created by underwater reefs. The beach with its’ grass-roofed shack that dates back to the early 1940's and is designated as a National Landmark, enjoys a colorful history involving the quintessential California surfing and beach culture integrated into the exclusive high-end community of La Jolla. Sandstone rocks act as partitions along the beach offering a secluded atmosphere for picnics, intimate gatherings and sunbathing. The magnificent sunsets bring to a peak this unforgettable, phenomenal-and romantic spectacle. It has been immortalized in many an account including the Tom Wolf’s famous book; The Pump House Gang.
notes: There is a 11.05% tax on rent
transit: La Jolla means ‘A Gem’ and it’s been known as that for more than one good reason. A leisurely walk or a short ride from the cottage takes you to the La Jolla village with landmarks and attractions like the La Valencia Hotel, Seals’ Beach, great restaurants including the celebrated George’s on the Cove, the Contemporary Art Museum and much more. This is a special place that retains its intimacy while providing a range of memorable, high-quality experiences.

neighborhood_overview: This is a fantastic neighborhood in La Jolla (San Diego) and everything is nearby!  If you need to get to the UCSD campus, it is just a few blocks away. You can walk, bike, or take the bus which stops nearby. If you are driving, we are just 3 minutes away from the 5 Freeway, which gets you to points north and south in minutes - just 15 minutes to downtown San Diego along the 5. Balboa Park, Sea World, San Diego Zoo, sailing and kayaking on Mission Bay, Pacific Beach, and La Jolla shores and other beaches, as well as downtown La Jolla with its wide range of stores and restaurants with sea views, are all 15 minutes away.  Also within walking distance (or 5 minutes by car) are some of the best restaurants, cafes, stores, a Starbucks, grocery store, a movie theater, and more. Parks, hiking and bike trails, beaches, kayaking and sailing are 5-10 minutes away.
notes: We have a park and swimming pool/hot tub within walking distance. The house is convenient to UCSD and if driving, to the 5 Freeway (just 3 minutes away).
transit: There are multiple buses (including a shuttle to UCSD) nearby. The entrance to the 5 Freeway is a 3-minute drive from the condo. Car rentals are also easy and there is a good shuttle which goes to the airport. When coming from the San Diego Airport:  The trip is very straightforward - just get on the 5 North and after about 15 minutes take the La Jolla Colony/Gilman Drive exit. The condo is three minutes away from this exit. I will send directions before your arrival.  You do not need a car to get around this neighborhood. Buses go directly to the UCSD campus and to all local shopping. Taxis and Uber are easy to use. I also have a bike at home, for your use.
access: You are welcome to use balcony and the beautiful garden patio, swimming pool and hot tub (pool/hot tub are a 3-minute walk). We also have a large park just a block away. Use of washer and dryer, fast Wi-Fi, and a bike are included.
interaction: I have been an Airbnb host for several years - check out the great reviews from my previous listing. I will be happy to answer any of your questions and to provide information about things to do in La Jolla and in San Diego, the best restaurants, attractions, stores, places on the UCSD campus, hiking and other outdoor activities, beaches, and much more. I am here for you when you need something but give you all of the personal space that you need. I really enjoy meeting new people from the Airbnb community.
house_rules: Enjoy the home and the area!  No pets please and smoking is ok on the patio outside.
host_about:
I am an architect and a professor here in San Diego. I have rented on AirBnB for almost two years and I use it myself all the time when I travel! I have lived in four different countries and enjoy meeting new people. I am fluent in English, Russian, Spanish, and Portuguese, and I also understand some French, Italian, and German. 

Favorite things: architecture, art, film, music, literature, travel, nature (hiking, camping), skiing, sailing, and waterskiing. 
I lived in San Diego for 8 years before and have recently returned to La Jolla - always happy to tell you about the city and our neighborhood.

name: Classic 20's La Jolla Beach House!
summary: Built in 1921, with arched doorways & beamed ceilings, my home is only footsteps from San Diego's most desirable beach. With colorful & enchanting decor, each room with an ocean view, relaxation and inspiration animate every moment. A treasure!
space: As an artist and a writer, I have created a space that glows with creative vibes. The house was built in 1921 and contains classic arched doorways and beamed ceilings. Just sitting on the couch is an inspiration! My home is an ideal setting for anyone who wants to get away from the chaos of everyday life. While staying here, you can go from the kitchen to the ocean in under two minutes. It truly is paradise. Unlike other areas in La Jolla, WindanSea is a down-to-earth, unpretentious, tiny community where neighbors congregate at the beach to watch the sunset each night. If you're looking for a warm, friendly, peaceful get-away, this is it!

neighborhood_overview: I love WindanSea. I've lived in three other areas of La Jolla, but this neighborhood is by far the best. People are laid-back, neighbors are friendly and helpful, and everyone is just stoked to be living in such a lovely place. La Jolla Village is just one mile away, as is the neighborhood of Bird Rock. Both places offer everything from hole-in-the-wall taco places to some of the finest dining in San Diego. You will love it here!
notes: I do not own a television.  A security deposit is held to prevent misuse property. You will only be charged if there is irreparable damage done to furniture, appliances, and/or amenities.
transit: The #30 bus stops at the top of the street, a minute's walk from the house. This bus can take you north to UCSD and University Town Center shopping mall and south to Old Town. From those places, you can connect to almost any destination in San Diego.
access: You will have access to the entire home, plus a large, grass yard (a rare gem in this neighborhood), one of San Diego's loveliest and most private beaches, and all the beach amenities and toys you will need.
interaction: I will greet you upon your arrival and will be available for any immediate needs you might have during your stay.
house_rules: The main thing to be mindful of in the house is noise. This is not a party house. Because the house is old and the floors are good, old-fashioned wood, the noise from the house to the apartment below travels easily. You will hear my neighbor (softly) and she will hear you. Mainly, it's footsteps and loud music that can be a problem. I would ask that guests walk with socks oR slippers and keep music low in early and late hours.  While it's not a party house, there is plenty of room to have a great time, even entertain guests! Just as long the noise stays relatively civil. If you intend to have guests over, either overnight or for an occasion, you will be required to inform me 24 hours ahead of time, or risk losing a portion of security deposit.  Another concern is plumbing and electricity. Again, because it's an old house and the pipes and electricity haven't been upgraded in a long time, they are a little delicate. You will receive instructions on how to manage these elements, which wi
host_about: I am a playwright and a small business owner and I split my time between Brooklyn, NY and the lovely beach-side community of WindanSea, in La Jolla, CA.

host_about:
As a  La Jolla native, I have seen many changes to our sweet village by the sea.  The constant however is the horizon; it is this endless view of magic that is just three blocks from my home and a perfect place to enjoy morning coffee and evening wine.

I am the grandmother of five lovely grandchildren, a retired school teacher having taught K through adult education, and a retired concierge from two magnificent local hotels.

Are there places you have traveled where you sense that you belong.....those places beyond the borders of your birth community?   It is one of my goals that your time in my home and in our village by the sea gives you that sense of belonging.

Passionate about  hospitality and meeting guests from all over the world, I look forward to  sharing the zen that my coastal home and garden paradise provides.

name: Stunning Windansea Ocean Front (A)!
summary: Wake up to the surf, fall asleep to the sound of the waves, enjoy spectacular sunsets all from the comfort of your home away from home! Walk to the village shops and restaurants, La Jolla Cove, step out to the sand and live your dream vacation!
space: This one of a kind location lives beautifully day and night! Floor to ceiling windows make for spectacular views from every room! Enjoy watching the surfers at world famous Windansea Beach from the comfort of your living room, step outside to stroll along the beach, walk to town to enjoy the fantastic restaurants and the best shopping La Jolla has to offer.  Everything in every room is brand new and waiting for you! All designed for your comfort during your stay. Light and bright this spacious 2 bedroom condo will far supersede all your vacation dreams!

neighborhood_overview: La Jolla is known as the jewel of San Diego for many reasons. The beaches are stunning, the weather is perfect year round, there are so many things to do and yet you could be perfectly content to do nothing and just enjoy the scenery.
notes: There is no other place like this one! The views are stunning, the location is extraordinary! I used to live there and can say without a doubt that it is a once in a lifetime opportunity to spend time in such a unique and exquisite place. We have done everything we can to ensure you have a beautiful, impeccable, comfortable and luxurious place to stay while in La Jolla! You can also combine this unit with the unit next door to accommodate parties up to 12 people. We have a 4 night minimum. Holiday rates vary. Monthly rates available from September to May. San Diego has an 11.05% occupancy tax to be paid by guest. Since airbnb does not collect this tax, this will be charged via Special Offer upon acceptance of reservation.
transit: Our condo is conveniently located walking distance to everything. Walk out your door to Windansea, take a stroll to the Cove to visit the tide pools and the seals, visit La Jolla Shores. There are so many great beaches around! You can also walk some great local eateries just a few blocks from the house. You can also venture down to Pacific Beach and cruise the boardwalk down to Mission Beach where there's even a roller coaster and great sight seeing! Or head north to Del Mar, head to horse races during the summer, take in a concert.  Having a car is great too because there are so many fun things to do in San Diego just a short distance away like Sea World, the Zoo and Balboa Park to name a few.  We have private parking with the unit.
access: Kitchen Our kitchen is fully stocked with a microwave, dishwasher, full size refrigerator, blender, toaster, coffee maker, brand new pots and pans, kitchen utensils and settings for 6 people. Dining We have a beautiful dining area that is off the living room and has spectacular view of the ocean. Living Room There is a queen size sofa bed in the living room. The bedding can be found in the linen closet. Internet There is wireless internet throughout the house. You will find the wifi code in the guest book. Phone We have a landline for your use for local calls. A/C There is an air conditioning unit in the living room for you to use as you please. Towels We have bath towels and beach towels for you to use during your stay. Washer Dryer There is a coin operated laundry facility in the building. Garage We have a one car garage that has an additional parking space behind it for your use. TVS Both the living room and the master bedroom have tvs. The living room has a brand new 50 inch flat s
interaction: I will meet you when you arrive, give you a tour and make sure you get settled and that all of your questions get answered. We live right up the street and are happy to help in anyway needed. I am a La Jolla local and love giving away my favorite restaurant, beach, shopping and activities tips. There is also a guest book with more information in the condo.
house_rules: We want you to enjoy your vacation while respecting our home.  As Stated in your Contract:  No smoking inside or anywhere on the property so you and future guests may enjoy the house cigarette / smoke free.  No pets, no exceptions. No parties area allowed. We want to respect our neighbors right to quiet enjoyment. The maximum number of guests allowed in and at the house is your reservation guest count ONLY. This is strictly enforced and you could lose your accommodations with no refund if you do not follow these rules as stated in the contract.   Check in is 4pm. Check out is 10am. There is a 250 cleaning fee.

The kitchen is fully stocked with cobalt blue dinnerware and unique serving pieces to serve large groups.

host_about:
About VRBJenn
VACATION RENTALS BY JENN
We are a boutique luxury vacation rental company in beautiful La Jolla, California serving only a handful of homes in order to guarantee impeccable personalized service to our owners and our guests.  Our luxury vacation rental properties are hand selected as the best La Jolla has to offer, consisting of multi-million dollar homes with all the amenities and concierge services of the world’s finest resorts.

All of our properties are privately owned. They are beautifully furnished, spotlessly clean and well-equipped to include everything you would need in a vacation home. Our goal is to place the right guest in the right home. Whether you are looking for a golfer’s gateway, a romantic home for your honeymoon, a luxury and extravagant home for a special occasion, a winter gateway during the cold months, a tranquil home near the beach to relax and forget all your worries or a family-friendly spacious home with a big grill & private pool, we have the perfect home for you. Let us help you plan the perfect vacation.

Full concierge services are available to each guest at no extra cost, including prearranged grocery delivery, luxury car rental, airport transportation, restaurant recommendations and reservations, discounted tickets to local attractions, babysitting services, private chefs, and much more. Personal service is our forte. We will be in touch with you in advance to make sure you have everything you need before you arrive, will meet you at the property for a tour of the villa and provide you with keys, an instruction manual for the house, and local information on our favorite things to do and places to eat in San Diego.  We take care of the little things so you can enjoy every single minute of your vacation.  If there is ever anything that you need during your vacation, please don’t hesitate to call us. We will be glad to assist you.

house_rules: Upon confirming your booking, we will send you a rental agreement for your upcoming stay which you will need to complete. If you are unable to complete and submit a signed agreement within 24 hours, we regret it will result in cancellation of your reservation. We will also contact you within 24 hours of the booking being made to ensure everyone meets the minimum age requirements, review our Good Neighborhood policies, and that you will not exceed the maximum occupancy of the home.    Renters must be at least 25 years old and must not exceed the maximum occupancy limits for the home. Quiet hours are from 10pm to 8am. Please refrain from loud outdoor noises, including any group parties, or any activity that would interfere with the quiet and peaceful enjoyment of the neighboring community. If the home is managed by an HOA, you also agree to follow all of the HOA`s rules and regulations.

neighborhood_overview: La Jolla California is an enchanting seaside community located within the city limits of San Diego. Dazzling ocean scenery awaits you in this exciting beachfront village. Everything that California is famous for can be found in La Jolla; white sand beaches, tide pools and sandy coves tucked between rocky cliffs, sunshine and year round comfortable temperatures lure thousands of visitors each year. Walk the exquisite beaches of La Jolla and watch sea lions and seals frolicking in the waves. The town of La Jolla is also home to a large salt water aquarium, and championship golf courses overlooking the Pacific Ocean are just minutes away. In downtown La Jolla you will still find many family owned businesses; art galleries, boutiques, antique shops, unique clothing and jewelry stores.

neighborhood_overview: La Jolla (Spanish for “the jewel”) has European elegance, a sunny Mediterranean climate, and some of the most picturesque beaches and beachfront properties in the world. Not far from downtown La Jolla,an upscale hamlet of hotels, boutiques, and galleries lies our neighborhood, La Jolla Cove, a swimming and diving paradise. This tiny beach nook, part of the San Diego La Jolla Underwater Park Ecological Reserve, is sheltered by picturesque cliffs and offers stunning views of the Pacific Ocean in an intimate setting. La Jolla Cove has some of the clearest water of all San Diego beaches, making it ideal for scuba diving and snorkeling.  La Jolla village offers great restaurants, art galleries, and boutiques. Treat yourself to a massage and facial at a day spa, stroll the coast, or simply  relax on the warm sand of La Jolla Cove - the pleasure will be guaranteed. There is also La Jolla Children’s Pool, which was supposed to be a swimming area for kids, as the name implies. The sea wall was
transit: We are walking distance from the shops, restaurants and beaches.

interaction: From the beginning of your stay with us, rest assure that we are only minutes away from you. Need information where to dine, get your coffee in the morning or which store has the best produce in town? Just call us. We also offer concierge service upon request.
house_rules: With respect to our wonderful neighborhood.
host_about:
I have been living a dream since I won the lottery 22 years ago.I have not stop smiling to this day, because he still loves me. 
We live in La Jolla with our sons and a dog, still have coffee together every morning at 6:15, and aperitif while he BBQs late in the afternoon. Like an addict, I shiver at the thought of breaking this routine. "It must last 75 more years," I keep repeating to myself.
We dream of Japan together, laugh about mistakes we made day before, and hope that our children find happiness in their lives. 
Books and old films are part of our dinner conversation, as much as arguments with our youngest who better comedian is-Fluffy or Kevin Heart? My favorite is Eddie Izzard, but they would't hear it. Which brings me to diversity. That leads us to variety. To an unfamiliar language, distinct style, taste for music, piece of art, food... Like different instruments in the orchestra, it all makes such a beautiful symphony at the end. It is Puccini one again. 
I love to travel. Usual destination-Europe, which I still call home. Buying a round trip ticket, going home both ways feels amusing, doesn't it?Also, did I mentioned that I won the lottery 22 years ago?

neighborhood_overview: Guests at Casa de las Olas can take a brief stroll down to the ocean and La Jolla Cove. Extraordinarily beautiful, La Jolla Cove is one of the most photographed shorelines in Southern California. Because it is a protected Ecological Reserve, marine wildlife abounds. Water visibility at the Cove can sometimes exceed 30 feet, making it a very popular spot for Scuba, snorkeling and kayaking. Once you`ve had your fill of the spectacular sights and sounds of the coast, take a stroll through The Village. The Village is a bustling business district offering world class dining, one-of-a-kind boutiques, art galleries, jewelry shops and romantic, old world hotels. The surrounding residential community is a charming mix of turn-of-the-century Spanish architecture, eccentric modern designs and everything in-between. Shopping in La Jolla tends toward the unusual and upscale; designer fashions, expensive jewelry, ethnic artifacts, priceless antiques, oriental rugs and exotic cars. Prospect Street is

As a  La Jolla native, I have seen many changes to our sweet village by the sea.  The constant however is the horizon; it is this endless view of magic that is just three blocks from my home and a perfect place to enjoy morning coffee and evening wine.

I am the grandmother of five lovely grandchildren, a retired school teacher having taught K through adult education, and a retired concierge from two magnificent local hotels.

Are there places you have traveled where you sense that you belong.....those places beyond the borders of your birth community?   It is one of my goals that your time in my home and in our village by the sea gives you that sense of belonging.

Passionate about  hospitality and meeting guests from all over the world, I look forward to  sharing the zen that my coastal home and garden paradise provides.

host_about:
About VRBJenn
VACATION RENTALS BY JENN
We are a boutique luxury vacation rental company in beautiful La Jolla, California serving only a handful of homes in order to guarantee impeccable personalized service to our owners and our guests.  Our luxury vacation rental properties are hand selected as the best La Jolla has to offer, consisting of multi-million dollar homes with all the amenities and concierge services of the world’s finest resorts.

All of our properties are privately owned. They are beautifully furnished, spotlessly clean and well-equipped to include everything you would need in a vacation home. Our goal is to place the right guest in the right home. Whether you are looking for a golfer’s gateway, a romantic home for your honeymoon, a luxury and extravagant home for a special occasion, a winter gateway during the cold months, a tranquil home near the beach to relax and forget all your worries or a family-friendly spacious home with a big grill & private pool, we have the perfect home for you. Let us help you plan the perfect vacation.

Full concierge services are available to each guest at no extra cost, including prearranged grocery delivery, luxury car rental, airport transportation, restaurant recommendations and reservations, discounted tickets to local attractions, babysitting services, private chefs, and much more. Personal service is our forte. We will be in touch with you in advance to make sure you have everything you need before you arrive, will meet you at the property for a tour of the villa and provide you with keys, an instruction manual for the house, and local information on our favorite things to do and places to eat in San Diego.  We take care of the little things so you can enjoy every single minute of your vacation.  If there is ever anything that you need during your vacation, please don’t hesitate to call us. We will be glad to assist you.
