neighborhood_overview: La Jolla is the home to the famous Torrey Pines Golf Course and the The Lodge at Torrey Pines which also offers well-groomed hiking trails with spectacular views. Along the dramatic coastline lies Scripps Park, where families can picnic throughout the summer while enjoying Fourth of July fireworks and concerts under the stars. There are plenty of cultural attractions to visit in La Jolla, with the Birch Aquarium at Scripps, La Jolla Playhouse and the Museum of Contemporary Art all situated in close proximity to the Village. La Jolla's biggest draw for locals and tourists alike, are the beaches. During the summer and autumn months, the surf is relatively gentle, with warm waters in 70s. Swimmers, snorkelers, scuba divers and surfers can enjoy the local beaches at La Jolla Shores, the Cove and Windansea.
notes: Plenty of off street parking. Note that parking spaces located on Eucalyptus Lane and around the townhome units are susceptible to be towed without permits.

neighborhood_overview: The Sunset Lodge is located at the boundary between three classic La Jolla neighborhoods.  We have Bird Rock to the South, the Lower Hermosa area to the West, and the Beach Barber Tract to the North.  This provides our guests with perfect opportunities to explore in all directions.  A few blocks to the south are the coffee shops, stores, and restaurants of Bird Rock.  To the North there are some of La Jolla's best quick bites.  The ocean and world famous Windansea beach lie just to the west, a 5 block walk.  The La Jolla bike path runs past the back gate, providing a car free route to the north and south for walking, running, or biking. Despite being close to so much, our neighborhood is a quiet one, full of beautiful homes and many families.  During the summer, kids are often playing on our street up and down the blocks through Bird Rock. One mile to the North lies the village of La Jolla where you will find world class dining, shopping and, of course, the famous La Jolla Cove and its
notes: There is so much to learn about the Sunset Lodge.  You can find out all the rest by searching for us on the web.  Type sunsetlodgelajolla (all one word) into your browser to find us.
transit: Flip flops and bikes are the way to get around sunny La Jolla in the summer. (Bikes are provided with the rental!).  But a quiet street and off-street parking will handle your cars, and there is a public bus stop just a block away.  A thriving Uber community completes the transportation picture.
access: The entire home and private yard is yours to enjoy.  Because this is our private residence for most of the year, we have a few locked  areas to keep our clutter out of your vacation.  These include an office on the first floor, the MBR closet (we provide alternative MBR clothes storage for our guests), and the garage.
interaction: We love to get to know our guests.  Up until mid-June we are happy to chat, email, etc. with you about any questions, special requests, or considerations you may have.  During the summer, we are on holiday (staying in other people's homes!) so we provide professional concierge services for you free of charge.  These are professionals who are highly rated and have been working in the vacation rental business for many years.
house_rules: Airbnb asks us to say "how do we expect our guests to behave?"  We expect our guests to have fun and the vacation of a lifetime!  With that said, the Sunset Lodge is in a quiet residential neighborhood.  If you do want to host an event of some kind, please let us know and we can work with you to come up with something that can work without damaging our relationship with our neighbors.
host_about: We are a family of 5 who, each summer, turn our home into a vacation rental and travel internationally for about 2 months.  Because we rent our home to other people, we understand how to be a good guest in the homes of others.  Because we rent the homes of others, we understand how to make our home the perfect vacation destination.
